item.title: nmm-stats
item.description: Source: bhAratendu on TW Some stats on the manuscripts in India, basis the data published by National Mission of Manuscripts. There are 5 million+ MSS so far catalogued, in public and private collections of India. While the MSS are in 100+ languages, these 21 account for 90% of MSS Sanskrit - 2,389,016 Odiya - 516,501 Hindi - 329,124 Tibetan - 283,668 Tamil - 179,815 Malayalam - 142,818 Kannada - 102,242 Rajasthani - 99,066 Persian - 98,482 Arabic - 92,591 Prakrit - 76,650 Urdu - 71,594 Gujarati - 52,055 Marathi - 44,593 Bengali - 39,917 Assamese - 38,294 Telugu - 26,342 Braja - 10,862 Punjabi - 7,103 Maithili - 6,052 Awadhi - 4,365 These MSS are also written in more than 100 distinct scripts, but these 18 account for 90% of all the MSS so far catalogued.
